node.title: 01/11/20 Chirunning Workshop Level 1
node._chi_workshop_additional_date_details: Open to all levels of Runners and walkers
node._chi_workshop_testimonialsquote00value:
WHAT I RAN AWAY WITH...

October 23, 2014

“The opportunity to experience Angela's ChiRunning workshop was a serendipitous chain of good fortune. I have never been coached in running. I run to support my eating habits, run through problems and keep my dog company. What was there to learn? Angela's approach is embodying – mindfully. An accomplished runner, Angela has the running faith and the wisdom to know there is more to running than a good pair of shoes and pavement. Patient in her instruction, she tells why ChiRunning is important, what benefits it brings and how it improves performance. Before and after videos reveal your personal running story – step by step. Am I a ChiRunner? While I have adopted ChiRunning techniques and listen more to my body, positively I now consider myself an informed conscious runner. I am glad I took Angela's course, the experience was a perfect blend of land, sea, learning and wanting more.”

Heather Walker, Vancouver, BC

node.title: 01/12/20 Chirunning Level 2 Workshop
node._chi_workshop_additional_date_details: must have attended a level 1 workshop
node._chi_workshop_testimonialsquote00value:
IT WAS A VERY WORTHWHILE EXPERIENCE

August 4, 2019

“I attended Angela's ChiRunning Class this weekend at the Whistler Wanderlust. It was a very worthwhile experience. Angela is an excellent coach. She guided us through a series of exercises including a walk to run exercise which demonstrated that running could actually feel effortless. I never thought I would be saying this!! Chi running guides us to listen to what our body needs, while also being conscious of the inner chatter of our minds. It teaches us to intentionally guide our thoughts to focus on our process, and lead from our core and inner strength. In addition to helping us run safely and efficiently, Chi Running provides excellent tools for grounding, and connecting with our authentic power.”

Robin Wheeler, Vancouver, BC

node.title: 02/29/20 - ChiWalking / ChiRunning Half Day Workshop - Matalon & Vaccaro

node._chi_workshop_name: ChiWalking & ChiRunning - Half & Full Day Workshops
node.title: 2/29/20 - ChiWalking, ChiRunning Half Day & ChiRunning Full Day Workshop - Vaccaro & Matalon
node.excerpt: What Your Workshop Includes: Keys to Effortless, Injury-free Walking & Running The Physics of Running: Run without Using Your Legs Chi Running versus Power Running Introduction to the Chi Running Form Posture, ankle Lift, moving from your center Personal Check-in Tricks and Tools Learning to Use Your Gears Core Muscle Drills and Exercise Cadence Hills Please contact the Instructor if you have any questions regarding the workshop.
node._chi_workshop_description:
All movement is good. Now focus on moving well. A well moving body is reflexively strong and stable. It provides a solid foundation to live a better life. Today's workshops will improve your performance, reduce the chance of injury and improve your energy efficiency. The result is confidence, speed, and distance with less effort. Join Master ChiWalking/ChiRunning Instructors Joel Matalon and Vince Vaccaro for this INDOOR Workshop. The half day ChiWalking and ChiRunning Workshops begin at 9:00am and end at 12:30. The Full Day ChiRunning Workshop begins at 9:00am and ends at 4:00pm. We will begin the workshops indoors and transition outdoor weather permitting. Dress in layers for both climates. During the workshops you will learn basic components of Original Strength (https://originalstrength.net/), ChiWalking and ChiRunning (https://www.chirunning.com/) as you move your body forward. We will be guided through exercises and drills designed to leave you with a clear sense of what the Chiwalking and ChiRunning technique feels like in your body. We will not be doing lots of running (contrary to what you might imagine), so no matter what condition you're in, have no fear. We will spend the day alternating between demonstrations, fun exercises and technique drills... the nature of the day will be relaxed, full, and inspiring.
What Your Workshop Includes:
  • Keys to Effortless, Injury-free Walking & Running
  • The Physics of Running: Run without Using Your Legs
  • Chi Running versus Power Running
  • Introduction to the Chi Running Form
  • Posture, ankle Lift, moving from your center
  • Personal Check-in Tricks and Tools
  • Learning to Use Your Gears
  • Core Muscle Drills and Exercise
  • Cadence
  • Hills
  • Please contact the Instructor if you have any questions regarding the workshop.
node._chi_workshop_instr_name: Joel Matalon - Vince Vaccaro - Master Instructors

node.title: 01/11/20 | ChiRunning Essentials Workshop | Danny Dreyer
node._chi_workshop_description:
ChiRunning Essentials Workshop: All Women's Class with Danny Dreyer & Mary Beth Freeman

This ChiRunning Essentials Workshop will cover all of the basic principles of ChiRunning: 
  • How to relax your legs
  • Engage your core
  • How to make full use of your upper body
  • Arm swing
  • Leg swing
  • Cadence
  • Efficient running at any speed
We will be guiding you through many exercises and drills to leave you with a clear sense of what the ChiRunning technique feels like, and how much easier it is on your body. Whether you’re a beginning runner or an avid marathoner, this workshop is for you! You will get lots of personal attention and enjoy a rich learning experience packed with good information to help you enjoy running injury-free for the rest of your life. This workshop will be co-taught by Founder Danny Dreyer and Mary Beth Freeman Certified ChiRunning Instructor. *This class will fulfill the prerequisite needed to attend Danny’s personal group technique and conditioning workouts on Tuesday evenings at UNCA track.

node._chi_workshop_name: ChiRunning - No Pain! All Gain! Injury Free 5K Workshop
node.title: 04/15/20 - ChiRunning - Vince Vaccaro
node._chi_workshop_additional_date_details: 8 Week Program ending June 3, 2020
node._chi_workshop_venue: Memorial Hospital - North Conway Community Room
node._chi_workshop_description: No Pain! All Gain! Injury Free 5K Workshop   Have you ever wanted to run but didn’t think you could? Now you can by using ChiRunning's Injury Free 5K Technique-based training program. All movement is good. We will focus on moving well. A well moving body is reflexively strong and stable. It provides a solid foundation to live a better life. Join community friends and family for this 8 week program (Wednesdays 5:30pm - 6:30pm). You will be supported every step of the way ensuring you cross the finish line! Registration includes weekly instruction, a customized 5K training program, entry into the Tunnel To Towers 5K Run & Walk on Saturday, June 6, 2020 and a commemorative T-shirt!   Led by Master ChiRunning Instructor Vince Vaccaro, ChiRunning is a powerful approach to injury free running that makes getting fit safe, easy, and fun. It's perfect for those who want to start a fitness program, lose weight, come back from an injury stronger, or set a personal record. ChiRunning will help you achieve your goals with less effort and without fear of injury.  To learn more about ChiRunning; www.ChiRunning.com.

node.title: 1/12/20 ChiRunning Workshop Lisa Pozzoni
node._chi_workshop_description:
ChiRunning Workshop Description You will get lots of personal attention and enjoy a rich learning experience packed with good information to help you run injury-free for the rest of your life. In this Workshop, you will learn the essential foundation skills for your ChiRunning Technique. I will be guiding you through many exercises and drills designed to leave you with a clear sense of what the ChiRunning technique feels like in your body. We will not be doing lots of running (contrary to what you might imagine), so no matter what condition you are in, have no fear. We will spend time alternating between demonstrations, fun exercises and technique drills ... the nature of the day will be relaxed, full and inspiring.   What you’ll get:
  • The Keys to Effortless, Injury-free Running
  • The Physics of Running: Run without Using Your Legs
  • ChiRunning versus Power Running
  • Introduction to the ChiRunning Form
  • Injury prevention techniques
  • Personal Check-in Tricks and Tools
  • Core Muscle Drills and Exercises
  • Pre-run Body Looseners, Post-run Stretches
  • Innovative technique drills
  • How to conserve energy at any speed
  Please contact me if you have any questions regarding the workshop.
node._chi_workshop_testimonialsquote00value: What was your favorite part of the workshop and why? Seeing the video of how bad my form was, this helped me reflect to a number of past problems and understand why they occurred. ~Stephen C My favorite part (among many) was when you ran with us and was able to identify what I was doing wrong and how to address it. I referred back to that suggestion the next day and it worked! ~ Terry M My favorite part is always Lisa's energy. She has such a positive energy and is very passionate about teaching Chi Running and it really comes across in the class. Also running is always a work in progress, there is always something you can do to run better. Chi Running and Lisa's classes are an awesome way to see how to improve your running. ~ Charles J Going outside and practicing after each lesson. I like that Lisa had us practice the chi running way and then compare to our old way during the same trip. I could really feel the difference! ~ Karla H The video evaluation. I thought I was applying a midfoot landing before I came to the workshop and quickly found out I wasn’t. ~ Missy F
node._chi_workshop_testimonialsquote10value: I have recommended the workshops to several friends. The ChiRunning Essentials class costs as much as a new pair of running shoes and you will get a lot more out of the class. I started running in my last 40's and realized, after I got hurt, that I should have worked on my running form. The classes are a great way to evaluate and improve your form. If I had taken the class before I hurt my knee, I think the injury would not have happened. ~ Charles J
node._chi_workshop_testimonialsquote20value: Lisa is very thorough. She goes through each aspect of your form and encourages you for the ones you are doing correctly and gives you helpful things to remember for the ones that need work. It doesn't matter if you are a beginner or more advanced, she will always encourage you with great enthusiasm. ~ Karla H

node.title: 03/14/20 ChiRunning Workshop Lisa Pozzoni
node._chi_workshop_description: During the 2 hours, you will be guided through several exercises and drills designed to leave you with a good sense of what the Chi Running technique feels like in your body. The goal is to learn to move as efficiently as possible. You'll learn how to make running easier by using your legs less and using gravity and your core muscles more (less impact on the ground and less energy usage means better recovery time and/or going faster and/or longer with less effort). You will learn about running posture, how and where your feet should land, how your arms should swing and cadence. You will be videotaped at the end of the workshop. Within 3 days of class, I will send you the video recording along with my voice over comments.  You will get specific feedback on how well you've assimilated the new information along with tips on how to keep improving. This workshop is appropriate for everyone, from the beginner to the elite! This investment will out weigh the hassle/money/time off that you would deal with a running injury! Prevention vs. Treatment!   Please contact me if you have any questions regarding the workshop.

node._chi_workshop_testimonialsquote20value: Lisa is very thorough. She goes through each aspect of your form and encourages you for the ones you are doing correctly and gives you helpful things to remember for the ones that need work. It doesn't matter if you are a beginner or more advanced, she will always encourage you with great enthusiasm. ~ Karla H

node.title: Free ChiRunning/ChiWalking Clinic: Lesson #1
node._chi_workshop_description:
In each clinic, I will introduce the ChiWalking/ChiRunning form. Walking and running are one of the best ways to lose weight and stay fit.
Most people walk and run by using the muscles in their legs. As a result, people lead with their legs and pull themselves forward (most walking and running injuries are mainly due to improper use of leg muscles!)
ChiRunning/ChiWalking teaches you to use your core muscles rather than your leg muscles, allowing your upper body to lead your lower body. This forward movement engages the pull of gravity, which then becomes your ally. This revolutionary method uses the same principles of T’ai Chi by working with core muscles, body alignment and body/mind integration resulting in a proven pain-free, energy efficient way to walk and run.
This, in turn, creates a more focused and enjoyable workout experience for lifelong health and energy.
It’s great for all fitness levels! If you are a beginner, you will learn the right technique before doing it incorrectly. For experienced walkers or runners, find out how you can take your performance to the next level. If you are injured, find out what you are doing incorrectly so you can get back to the sport you love.

node.title: 1/07-3/10/20 | Winter 2020 Training Program (10-week) | Danny Dreyer
node._chi_workshop_additional_date_details: Meet every Tuesday & Sunday morning (optional)
node._chi_workshop_description:
Don't let winter slow you down!

Join Danny Dreyer for his 10-week Winter 2020 Training Program

We will be starting up our Winter 2020 Training program on Tuesday evening, January 7th. We'll meet at the Reuter Center parking lot (upper entrance to the building) on a weekly basis for the next ten weeks.  We will also meet every Sunday morning at Bent Creek Hardtimes Trailhead at 8:30am for long runs (optional).
Tuesday evening Track Workouts*: We'll be doing a mix of track intervals and hill intervals. These workouts are designed for ALL levels of runners... from beginners to seasoned runners. So, if you've never done track workouts before, you're in good hands. All of these workouts will contain a healthy dose of running technique to make your running more efficient and injury-free. It's the perfect way to prepare for a Spring race event!
The fee for attending these workouts is $80 for 10 weeks, or you can pay a $10 drop-in fee.
*These workouts are ONLY open to those who have:
a.) Participated in a previous Asheville Training Program with Danny
b.) Attended a ChiRunning Workshop (Full or Half-day)
c.) Taken a private session with Danny
 
Sunday morning long runs**: If you're training for the Asheville Biltmore half or full marathons this is perfect for you. In these long runs, we'll also be focusing on technique to help you run those uphills and downhills in the best way possible, with the least amount of effort. For those of you who are training for the AVL Biltmore Half or Full we'll be doing mock-ups of the actual course you'll be running on race day. Race-specific training is the best training there is.
It doesn't matter what your long run distance or speed is, you'll be surrounded by an accommodating and supportive group of runners. These long runs will prepare you for any event you plan to run in the Spring.
**These long runs are FREE and open to anyone.

node.title: 2/29/20 ChiRunning Workshop Julie Morvant
node._chi_workshop_description:
ChiRunning Workshop   Workshop Description You will get lots of personal attention and enjoy a rich learning experience packed with good information to help you run injury-free for the rest of your life.   In this Workshop, you will learn the essential foundation skills for your ChiRunning Technique. I will be guiding you through many exercises and drills designed to leave you with a clear sense of what the ChiRunning technique feels like in your body. We will not be doing lots of running (contrary to what you might imagine), so no matter what condition you are in, have no fear. We will spend time alternating between demonstrations, fun exercises and technique drills ... the nature of the day will be relaxed, full and inspiring.   What you’ll get:
  • The Keys to Effortless, Injury-free Running
  • The Physics of Running: Run without Using Your Legs
  • ChiRunning versus Power Running
  • Introduction to the ChiRunning Form
  • Injury prevention techniques
  • Personal Check-in Tricks and Tools
  • Core Muscle Drills and Exercises
  • Pre-run Body Looseners, Post-run Stretches
  • Innovative technique drills
  • How to conserve energy at any speed
  Please contact me if you have any questions regarding the workshop.

node.title: 3/28/20 | ChiRunning Essentials Workshop | Danny Dreyer
node._chi_workshop_description:
ChiRunning Essentials Workshop

This ChiRunning Essentials Workshop will cover all of the basic principles of ChiRunning: 
  • How to relax your legs
  • Engage your core
  • How to make full use of your upper body
  • Arm swing
  • Leg swing
  • Cadence
  • Efficient running at any speed
We will be guiding you through many exercises and drills to leave you with a clear sense of what the ChiRunning technique feels like, and how much easier it is on your body. Whether you’re a beginning runner or an avid marathoner, this workshop is for you! You will get lots of personal attention and enjoy a rich learning experience packed with good information to help you enjoy running injury-free for the rest of your life. This workshop will be co-taught by Founder Danny Dreyer and Mary Beth Freeman Certified ChiRunning Instructor. *This class will fulfill the prerequisite needed to attend Danny’s personal group technique and conditioning workouts on Tuesday evenings at UNCA track.

node.title: 02/02/2020-ChiRunning Clinic-Sarah Richardson
node._chi_workshop_additional_date_details: Berlin Elementary School is located in Central Vermont and right off of RT 89, easy access and plenty of parking.
node._chi_workshop_description:
Workshop Description In this workshop you will learn the basic components of the Chi Running technique and how to implement it in your body. We will be guiding you through many exercises and drills designed to leave you with a clear sense of what the Chi Running technique feels like in your body. We will not be doing lots of running (contrary to what you might imagine), so no matter what condition you're in, have no fear. We will spend the day alternating between demonstrations, fun exercises and technique drills... the nature of the day will be relaxed, full, and inspiring.  

Outline for the Day: 

Morning Session

  • The Keys to Effortless, Injury-free Running
  • The Physics of Running: Run without Using Your Legs
  • Introduction to the Chi Running Form
  • Posture
  • Leading with your Dantien
  • ChWalking
  • Arm Swing
  • Stride Length/Leaning to Use Your Gears
  • Cadence
  • Personal Check-in Tricks and Tools
  • Core Muscle Drills and Exercise
Lunch: Conversation over lunch as we answer your questions

Afternoon Session

  • Putting it all Together
  • ChiRunning
  • Pre-run Body Looseners, Post-run Stretches
  • Hills
  • Personal Check-in Tricks and Tools
  • Core Muscle Drills and Exercises
  • Your 3 Main Focuses Clarified!
Notes We will have a combo of indoor and outdoor time, so please bring appropriate clothing (layers). Feel free to bring water, light lunch and/or a snack.
node._chi_workshop_testimonialsquote00value: Nailed My Form. I was so excited to find ChiRunning. Getting back into running as an adult was a little scary and I didn't know if I was doing it quite right. I did not have the time for pain, injuries or being out of commission, yet wanted to get back into shape... safely.  Sarah has helped me nail my form before injuries could crop up and I haven't looked back. She taught how to move my body with proper form and how to listen to my body.  I'm so glad that I can run with my friends and have been able to safely compete in races I never thought I could do!   ~Andrea
node._chi_workshop_testimonialsquote10value: Check. Check. Being a busy working mom, I wanted an activity I could do on the fly and I chose running. But I hadn't ever been a runner before. ChiRunning was the perfect place to start. Sarah helped me stay safe and sound while I trained for my first race ever, which was a half-marathon! As a teacher, she was extremely patient and made it so understandable and I could actually FEEL if I was doing it right or wrong. I'm so glad that I took the time to learn my form, it made all the the difference in the world.   ~Maureen

node.title: 04/11/20, ChiRunning, Richard Felton - Clone
node._chi_workshop_additional_date_details: Arriving around 9 AM will allow proper check in
node._chi_workshop_description:
This ChiRunning workshop will include all of the principals and drills to allow you to be in a position to take advantage of the benefits of "Energy Efficiency" and "Injury Prevention" while running. The exercises and techniques you will learn can be applied to your everyday life to allow for healthy movement and exercise without detrimental strain on your body (or mind)
Dave Walker (Instructor) and I (Master Certifying Instructor) will give everyone attending personal attention to make sure that you understand the concept and way forward

node.title: 6/13/20 | AVL, NC | ChiRunning Workshop | Danny Dreyer
node._chi_workshop_description:
RESCHEDULED TO JUNE 13TH*

Running Never Felt this Good!

Danny Dreyer, ultramarathoner, best- selling author, and ChiRunning founder, will share the keys to easier and enjoyable running. Assisted by a team of Certified Instructors, Danny will give you the personalized feedback you need to take your running form and practice to the next level.
Is this the workshop for me?
Yes! Runners and run-walkers of all capabilities will benefit from this workshop, from beginners to seasoned marathoners and elites.
What Your Workshop Includes:
  • Learn to Run Injury- Free Leave knee pain, IT- Band Syndrome, and other aches and pains in the dust. Danny has combined his 20+ years of running and T’ai Chi practice to create a running technique that is proven to reduce impact*, which significantly reduces injury and risk of injury. In this workshop you’ll learn how, and why, it works.
  • Run Farther and Faster with Less Effort Streamline your running by using your energy wisely. With good body mechanics, relaxation and breathing techniques, you’ll learn how to prevent fatigue, improve your endurance, and gain speed.
  • Tips to Train Your Best Whether you’re training for a marathon or your first 5K, ChiRunning will help you master your next race and minimize recovery time.
  • Plenty of Practice You’ll practice running drills and exercises designed to help you instill the technique in your body.
  • Breathing Skills Learn effective breathing techniques to make running easier and energizing
  • The Scoop on Shoes Barefoot? Minimal? Stability? Danny is a running shoe tester and a true authority. He’ll explain your shoe options and how to choose the one that’s best for you.
  • Answers to All Your Running Questions There will be a Q&A during lunch, so bring all of your questions!
What You Need to Bring:
  • To maximize your learning experience, we recommend reading the first four chapters of the ChiRunning book and/or watching the ChiRunning DVD prior to your workshop.
  • Please bring your own lunch and water.
  • Wear running shoes, sunscreen, and weather appropriate clothing.

Win a Free Virtual Coaching Session with Danny!

When you sign up for Danny's workshops, you’ll automatically be entered in a drawing to win a free, 30-minute Virtual Coaching follow-up session with Danny – a $110 value. Danny will pull the winner’s name from a hat during the workshop. Once you’ve registered, ChiLiving® will send you an email receipt. Please provide the email you most commonly use during your checkout process to ensure that you receive all workshop emails. Workshop emails begin 4 weeks out from the workshop and are sent every Friday. If you are interested in scheduling a private workshop with Danny, click here to schedule a one or two-hour session. Please email Katherine@ChiLiving.com to set up your private workshop time. *Dr. Don Goss’s 2012 Univ. of North Carolina- Chapel Hill Study shows that ChiRunning reduces impact when compared to other common running forms. *This date is subject to change dependent on the state of the pandemic.

node.title: 6/13/20 | AVL, NC | ChiWalking Workshop | Danny Dreyer
node._chi_workshop_description:
RESCHEDULED TO JUNE 13TH*

Danny Dreyer, ultramarathoner, best- selling author, and ChiWalking® & ChiRunning® founder, will share the keys to easier and enjoyable walking. Assisted by a team of Certified Instructors, Danny will give you the personalized feedback you need to take your walking form and practice to the next level.
Is This Workshop for Me?
Yes! ChiWalking is beneficial for everyone, even those recovering from or managing illness or injury. The ChiWalking principles are covered in the first half of the running workshop. There will be no running during this time, but you will practice plenty of walking exercises & drills. If you’re inspired to try ChiRunning after experiencing how easy ChiWalking can be, you can choose to join the walk-run group and stay for the afternoon session for an additional $100.
You’ll Learn How To:
• Maximize the power of your core to move forward.  Most walking injuries occur from the waist down. When we initiate movement from our core, the body’s largest muscle group, we don’t need to use our legs for propulsion. This greatly reduces impact, pain, and risk of injury. A strong core also improves posture, balance, and stability. • Unite your Upper Body and Lower Body. The Chi techniques are all about keeping your energy flowing so you can move efficiently. You’ll learn how to optimize your movement to keep the workload balanced between your Upper Body and Lower Body. • Get the results you want with fitness walking. With good body mechanics and relaxation techniques, you'll improve your endurance and gain speed while preventing fatigue. You’ll be able to walk farther and faster with less effort so you can make your fitness goals a reality. • Plenty of Practice. You'll practice walking drills and exercises designed to help you instill the technique in your body. Lunch: Bring a lunch and join us for an hour of informal questions & answers.
What You Need To Bring:
• To maximize your learning experience, we recommend reading the ChiWalking book and/or watching the ChiWalking DVD prior to your workshop. • Please bring your own lunch and water. • Wear athletic shoes, sunscreen, and weather appropriate clothing. Once you have registered, ChiLiving® will send you an email receipt. Please provide the email that you most commonly use during your checkout process to ensure that you receive all Workshop emails. Workshop emails begin 4 weeks out from the Workshop and are sent every Friday. If you are interested in scheduling a private Workshop with Danny, click here to schedule a 1 or 2-hour session. Please email customerservice@chiliving.com to set up your private workshop time. *This date is subject to change dependent on the state of the pandemic.

node.title: 2/7/20 | Free Talk at REI with Danny Dreyer | SMO, CA
node._chi_workshop_description:
Chi Sessions: Improving Outdoor Activity with Danny Dreyer

Outdoor activity shouldn't hurt your body, it's the WAY you move that can cause problems. The two biggest causes of all fitness injuries are overuse of muscles and too much impact to your joints. Both of these can be identified and managed through the mindful movement techniques taught in the Chi method. In this free Chi Series, Danny Dreyer, founder of ChiRunning (and Asheville local) will talk about how to train, condition, and strengthen sustainably. Integrating Chi methods in a way that'll keep you moving and feeling fabulous for years to come whether walking, running, hiking, or cross-training. Come with any of your own training questions, and be prepared to get energized by adding a mindful approach to your fitness practice! Each Month Danny will discuss a new topic. Check out the notes below for this month's focus.

node.title: 02/15/20 Free ChiRunning/ChiWalking Clinic Lisa Pozzoni
node._chi_workshop_description: In each clinic, I will introduce the ChiWalking/ChiRunning form. Walking and running are one of the best ways to lose weight and stay fit. This event is being hosted by Sports Medicine Acupuncturist, Jody Murray from Acupuncture Therapy at AZSDS, who will be on hand to answer your sports medicine questions. Jody will be available after the workshop to quickly evaluate any injuries you may currently have. Most people walk and run by using the muscles in their legs. As a result, people lead with their legs and pull themselves forward (most walking and running injuries are mainly due to improper use of leg muscles!) ChiRunning/ChiWalking teaches you to use your core muscles rather than your leg muscles, allowing your upper body to lead your lower body. This forward movement engages the pull of gravity, which then becomes your ally. This revolutionary method uses the same principles of T’ai Chi by working with core muscles, body alignment and body/mind integration resulting in a proven pain-free, energy efficient way to walk and run. This, in turn, creates a more focused and enjoyable workout experience for lifelong health and energy. It’s great for all fitness levels! If you are a beginner, you will learn the right technique before doing it incorrectly. For experienced walkers or runners, find out how you can take your performance to the next level. If you are injured, find out what you are doing incorrectly so you can get back to the sport you love.

node.title: 02/16/20 ChiWalking Lisa Pozzoni
node._chi_workshop_description: ChiWalking 101 1pm-2:30pm $25 (both for $40) The ChiWalking technique emphasizes the proper biomechanics of walking including: good  posture, loose joints, engaging one’s core muscles, and relaxing the peripheral muscles of the arms and legs. This approach makes walking easier on the body and helps improve and eliminate the aches, pains and discomfort of walking incorrectly. Since walking is such a basic, every day movement, when your walking form is improved, the benefits are far reaching. I will guide you through some exercises and drills designed to leave you with a clear sense of what the Chi Walking technique feels like in your body.  We will go over Posture, Moving from your Center/Core and Relaxed Arms and Legs. You will leave this class with a good understanding of how to move your body with the ChiWalking technique. LIMITED SPOTS FOR 10 PEOPLE (The ChiWalking Menu immediately following from 230-4pm Optional)

node.title: 02/16/20 ChiWalking Lisa Pozzoni
node._chi_workshop_additional_date_details: ChiWalking 101 required (available right before this class)
node._chi_workshop_description: The ChiWalking Menu (12 ChiWalks) (For ChiRunning or ChiWalking 101 Alumni Only) 2:30-4pm $25 (both for $40) During this session you will get a flavor for the 12 different ChiWalks you can pick from. You will be introduced to the expanded world of walking, where you can become the master of your body and mind. These walks work on all four levels: physical, emotional, mental and spiritual. You’ll have 12 different types of walk to choose from depending on what energy you need in your life at that moment. I will explain what each ChiWalk entails and we will practice that particular walk for a bit.  The walks are:  The Cardio Walk, The Aerobic Walk, The Hilly Walk, The Loosening Walk, The Upper Body Walk, The Chi-Gathering Walk, The Energizing Walk, The Focusing Walk, The Walking Meditation, The Calming Walk, The Grounding Walk,  and Racewalking. We will not be walking the entire 90 minutes. LIMITED SPOTS FOR 10 PEOPLE

node.title: 05/29/2000 ChiWalk-Run Workshop Angela James
node._chi_workshop_additional_date_details: Running and Yoga Retreat in Sonoma Wine Country! ChiRunning ~ Yoga ~ Wine Tasting ~ Nutrition ~ Recovery ~ Mindfulness for Runners.
node._chi_workshop_description: Yoga Instructor, Running Coach, ChiRunning/ChiWalking Instructor, Massage Therapist, Reiki Practitioner Join us for an energizing yoga, running and wine tasting weekend getaway in beautiful Sonoma wine country! Improve your health and fitness, destress from your everyday life, and connect with other like-minded active runners and yogis! Learn injury-free and energy-efficient ChiRunning and ChiWalking, for all levels of runners, wannabe runners or hikers, making running or walking effortless by letting gravity do the work. Blending principles of Tai Chi with running and walking, you move from your core muscles, allow gravity to assist your forward momentum, and let your legs relax. This reduces impact and eliminates the cause of injury, helping you to run or walk more safely, for longer, feel lighter and more relaxed, run or walk faster, further, and enjoy running or walking for a lifetime! You'll learn proper alignment and posture, injury prevention and energy efficiency techniques, efficient breathing, and mindful and meditative running tips. The yoga classes will be mostly Vinyasa Flow for all levels, linking movement with the breath, moving your body through both power and restorative poses, and there will be Yin classes offered as well, which include deep stretches for active recovery after running or hiking. With creative and balanced sequences, strengthening and lengthening, detoxing and pranayama, you will experience a strong, safe and supportive practice. Modifications and options will be provided for different abilities. Connect mind, body, and soul. Transform your running and your self! All levels are welcome and encouraged. We will have multiple run/hike leaders for the runs and hikes to assist with varying distances and paces.
node._chi_workshop_instr_name: Angela James, Sally Mitchell and Bryn Randolph Milton
node._chi_workshop_testimonialsquote10value:
"An inspiring weekend with amazing women from across the U.S. The ranch setting was serene and quiet and allowed for learning, self-discovery and new friends. Highly recommend!" ~ Patricia, Aug 2015

"My running injuries are healing well thanks to you and ChiRunning. I can even run on the pavement without further damaging my body. Also, bruising on my toes is almost gone. You are a miracle-worker!" - Rowena

node.title: 07/ 25/2020 Chirunning Workshop Angela James
node._chi_workshop_additional_date_details: Angela is also offering a Leve 2 workshop on Sunday July 26th. Check website for more details www.angelajames.com
node._chi_workshop_testimonialsquote00value:
October 23, 2019

“The opportunity to experience Angela's ChiRunning workshop was a serendipitous chain of good fortune. I have never been coached in running. I run to support my eating habits, run through problems and keep my dogs company. What was there to learn? Angela's approach is embodying – mindfully. An accomplished runner, Angela has the running faith and the wisdom to know there is more to running than a good pair of shoes and pavement. Patient in her instruction, she tells why ChiRunning is important, what benefits it brings and how it improves performance. Before and after videos reveal your personal running story – step by step. Am I a ChiRunner? While I have adopted ChiRunning techniques and listen more to my body, positively I now consider myself an informed conscious runner. I am glad I took Angela's course, the experience was a perfect blend of land, sea, learning and wanting more.”

Heather Walker, Vancouver, BC

Notes We will have a combo of indoor and outdoor time, so please bring appropriate clothing (layers). Feel free to bring water, light lunch and/or a snack.
node._chi_workshop_testimonialsquote00value: Nailed My Form. I was so excited to find ChiRunning. Getting back into running as an adult was a little scary and I didn't know if I was doing it quite right. I did not have the time for pain, injuries or being out of commission, yet wanted to get back into shape... safely.  Sarah has helped me nail my form before injuries could crop up and I haven't looked back. She taught how to move my body with proper form and how to listen to my body.  I'm so glad that I can run with my friends and have been able to safely compete in races I never thought I could do!   ~Andrea
node._chi_workshop_testimonialsquote10value: Check. Check. Being a busy working mom, I wanted an activity I could do on the fly and I chose running. But I hadn't ever been a runner before. ChiRunning was the perfect place to start. Sarah helped me stay safe and sound while I trained for my first race ever, which was a half-marathon! As a teacher, she was extremely patient and made it so understandable and I could actually FEEL if I was doing it right or wrong. I'm so glad that I took the time to learn my form, it made all the the difference in the world.   ~Maureen

node.title: 05/03/2020-ChiRunning Clinic-Sarah Richardson
node._chi_workshop_additional_date_details: Enjoy your drive through the Champlain Islands to attend this full day clinic.
node._chi_workshop_venue: TBD: On Isle La Motte, Vermont
node._chi_workshop_description:
Workshop Description In this workshop you will learn the basic components of the Chi Running technique and how to implement it in your body. We will be guiding you through many exercises and drills designed to leave you with a clear sense of what the Chi Running technique feels like in your body. We will not be doing lots of running (contrary to what you might imagine), so no matter what condition you're in, have no fear. We will spend the day alternating between demonstrations, fun exercises and technique drills... the nature of the day will be relaxed, full, and inspiring.  

Outline for the Day: 

Morning Session

  • The Keys to Effortless, Injury-free Running
  • The Physics of Running: Run without Using Your Legs
  • Introduction to the Chi Running Form
  • Posture
  • Leading with your Dantien
  • ChWalking
  • Arm Swing
  • Stride Length/Leaning to Use Your Gears
  • Cadence
  • Personal Check-in Tricks and Tools
  • Core Muscle Drills and Exercise
Lunch: Conversation over lunch as we answer your questions

Afternoon Session

  • Putting it all Together
  • ChiRunning
  • Pre-run Body Looseners, Post-run Stretches
  • Hills
  • Personal Check-in Tricks and Tools
  • Core Muscle Drills and Exercises
  • Your 3 Main Focuses Clarified!
Notes We will have a combo of indoor and outdoor time, so please bring appropriate clothing (layers). Feel free to bring water, light lunch and/or a snack.

node.title: 04/18/20 Chirunning Workshop Angela James
node._chi_workshop_testimonialsquote00value:
April 16, 2019

“Angela James and ChiRunning changed my life! Sounds dramatic, but being in advertising, I've often bought into and sold the expectation of change as a big dramatic flash-bang moment. In fact, it's the quiet, joyful realization that not only did I PR my 36th marathon, but I enjoyed every moment of the sunny autumn run. Recovery was negligible, and it's all because of the springtime ChiRunning courses with Angela and her weekly Chi Runs, which are immensely valuable in practicing good chi form. Angela's advice, specific to the lesson on shoulders, "to relax, stop trying so hard and just be", has been something of a game-changer in my running and life. So dramatics aside, ChiRunning delivered through Angela who, everyone will agree, is a bundle of positive energy, is life-changing in a perfect chi-footsteps-in-the-sand way.”

Melanie Last

node.title: 5/23/20 Half Day ChiRunning Jean Gillis MA
node._chi_workshop_description:
Workshop Description

In this Workshop, you will learn the essential foundation skills for your ChiRunning Technique. I will guide you through many exercises and drills designed to leave you with a clear sense of what the ChiRunning technique feels like in your body. We will not be doing lots of running (contrary to what you might imagine), so no matter what condition you are in, have no fear. We will spend time alternating between demonstrations, fun exercises and technique drills. The nature of the day will be relaxed, full and inspiring.

 

What you’ll get:

• The Keys to Effortless, Injury-free Running

• The Physics of Running: Run without Using Your Legs

• ChiRunning versus Power Running

• Introduction to the ChiRunning Form

• Personal Check-in Tricks and Tools

• Pre-run Body Looseners

• Innovative Technique Drills

• Running with Cadence

• Tips for Running Hills, Breathing, Being Light on Your Feet • Creating Your Training Plan

 Please contact me if you have any questions regarding the workshop.
node._chi_workshop_testimonialsquote00value: “In May 2019, I was sent to the Massachusetts Army National Guard Warrior FIT program where I met Jean. Jean was teaching ChiRunning, a technique that I had never heard of. I have always hated running and had never really done much distance running before. After being coached by Jean for 3 months, I have a new found love for running and even saw almost 5 minutes drop off my two mile run. Running has never felt so good or been so enjoyable for me. I look forward to continue using the ChiRunning technique as I continue toward my fitness goals. I cannot thank Jean enough for bringing this technique to the Warrior FIT program.” Paul Army National Guardsman

node.title: 8/22/2020 Full Day Chi Running Workshop -Ken Presutti
node._chi_workshop_description:
This workshop is a great way for runners to learn the technique by working with one of ChiRunnings highly qualified instructors.

Event details and schedule

In this workshop you will learn the basic ingredients of the ChiRunning® Technique. Participants may choose to join for the first  half of the day only, or stay for both the first and second halves of the day. Those who have attended a previous workshop may sign up for the second half of the day only, should they wish to do so. The ChiRunning workshop will be broken into two differnt sessions. The Instructor will be guiding you through many exercises and drills designed to leave you with a clear sense of what the ChiRunning technique feels like in your body. We will not be doing lots of running (contrary to what you might imagine), so no matter what condition you are in, have no fear. We will spend time alternating between demonstrations, fun exercises and technique drills...the nature of the day will be relaxed, full and inspiring. The first half of the workshop will include the following focuses:
  • The Keys to Effortless, Injury-free Running
  • The Physics of Running: Run without Using Your Legs
  • Chi Running versus Power Running
  • Introduction to the Chi Running Form
  • Posture, Lean, Lift
  • Personal Check-in Tricks and Tools
  • Learning to Use Your Gears
  • Core Muscle Drills and Exercise
Lunch: Bring a lunch and join us for an hour of informal questions & answers The second half of the workshop will include the following focuses:
  • Pre-run Body Looseners, Post-run Stretches
  • Run Various Speeds While Conserving Energy
  • Keeping a consistent cadence
  • Hills

node._chi_workshop_name: Chi Running "Spring Fling" with Roger Thompson
node.title: ChiRunning "Spring Fling"
node._chi_workshop_additional_date_details: Learn a revolutionary way to run in my ChiRunning "Spring Fling"
node._chi_workshop_description:
Learn a revolutionary way to run in my ChiRunning "spring Fling"
Join me for an energizing morning /afternoon of ChiRunning and some Tai Chi and yoga breathing exercises for efficient breathing and mindful / meditative running tips to improve your health and fitness and destress from our everyday life.
Participants will experience ways to prevent injury and recover faster. Everyone will come away with a sense of what ChiRunning feels like in your body that will have you experience "ah-ha" moments when you realize how if feels when you run relaxed.
Attendees will alternate between ChiRunning demonstrations and fun exercises and drills.
Ideal for all skill levels from the novice runner to the podium finisher!
Through energy efficient running melded with Tai Chi, participants will learn:
-posture and alignment
-upper body kinematics and arm swing
-moving from the Dantien
-rhythmic running
This energy efficient, mindful, injury free running workshop is Saturday, March 21, 2020 from 9am to 1pm

node.title: 04/26/20 ChiRunning Workshop Lisa Pozzoni
node._chi_workshop_description: During the 2 hours, you will be guided through several exercises and drills designed to leave you with a good sense of what the Chi Running technique feels like in your body. The goal is to learn to move as efficiently as possible. You'll learn how to make running easier by using your legs less and using gravity and your core muscles more (less impact on the ground and less energy usage means better recovery time and/or going faster and/or longer with less effort). You will learn about running posture, how and where your feet should land, how your arms should swing and cadence. You will be videotaped at the end of the workshop. Within 3 days of class, I will send you the video recording along with my voice over comments.  You will get specific feedback on how well you've assimilated the new information along with tips on how to keep improving. This workshop is appropriate for everyone, from the beginner to the elite! This investment will out weigh the hassle/money/time off that you would deal with a running injury! Prevention vs. Treatment!   Please contact me if you have any questions regarding the workshop.
node._chi_workshop_testimonialsquote00value: What was your favorite part of the workshop and why? Seeing the video of how bad my form was, this helped me reflect to a number of past problems and understand why they occurred. ~Stephen C My favorite part (among many) was when you ran with us and was able to identify what I was doing wrong and how to address it. I referred back to that suggestion the next day and it worked! ~ Terry M My favorite part is always Lisa's energy. She has such a positive energy and is very passionate about teaching Chi Running and it really comes across in the class. Also running is always a work in progress, there is always something you can do to run better. Chi Running and Lisa's classes are an awesome way to see how to improve your running. ~ Charles J Going outside and practicing after each lesson. I like that Lisa had us practice the chi running way and then compare to our old way during the same trip. I could really feel the difference! ~ Karla H The video evaluation. I thought I was applying a midfoot landing before I came to the workshop and quickly found out I wasn’t. ~ Missy F
node._chi_workshop_testimonialsquote10value: I have recommended the workshops to several friends. The ChiRunning Essentials class costs as much as a new pair of running shoes and you will get a lot more out of the class. I started running in my last 40's and realized, after I got hurt, that I should have worked on my running form. The classes are a great way to evaluate and improve your form. If I had taken the class before I hurt my knee, I think the injury would not have happened. ~ Charles J
node._chi_workshop_testimonialsquote20value: Lisa is very thorough. She goes through each aspect of your form and encourages you for the ones you are doing correctly and gives you helpful things to remember for the ones that need work. It doesn't matter if you are a beginner or more advanced, she will always encourage you with great enthusiasm. ~ Karla H

node.title: Half-day ChiRunning Workshop | Danny Dreyer | TBD | Asheville, NC
node._chi_workshop_description:
ChiRunning Essentials Workshop

This ChiRunning Essentials Workshop will cover all of the basic principles of ChiRunning: 
  • How to relax your legs
  • Engage your core
  • How to make full use of your upper body
  • Arm swing
  • Leg swing
  • Cadence
  • Efficient running at any speed
We will be guiding you through many exercises and drills to leave you with a clear sense of what the ChiRunning technique feels like, and how much easier it is on your body. Whether you’re a beginning runner or an avid marathoner, this workshop is for you! You will get lots of personal attention and enjoy a rich learning experience packed with good information to help you enjoy running injury-free for the rest of your life.

node.title: ChiRunning Student Athlete Program | July 13th Live Session
node._chi_workshop_additional_date_details: Meeting virtually every Wednesday
node._chi_workshop_description:
LIVE 6-week Program Begins July 13th

Join some of our top Master Instructors for a 6-week Student Athlete Program! Perfect for High School XC, track, and soccer athletes! Or, any student that wants to master running & actually enjoy it along the way.

Equip Yourself with Proper Running Form & Outperform Your Teammates

Typically, high school coaches are focused on motivation and team/sport logistics while training is limited to generalized or basic programs. Almost no time is spent on teaching athletes how to run correctly! Student athletes usually suffer high-injury rates, don’t reach their fullest potential, and/or quit the sport altogether!
Level 1
What does it include: 
  • Six 1-hour weekly live instructional sessions via Zoom Interactive sessions led by Master Instructor Marc Waxman
  • Replay recordings of each session
Level 2
What does it include: 
  • Six 1-hour weekly live instructional sessions via Zoom Interactive sessions led by Master Instructor Marc Waxman
  • Replay recordings of each session
  • Four one-on-one Zoom coaching sessions based on your specific needs (45-min)
Custom 6-wk Training Program Add-on
Get an individualized online Training Plan added on to either level of the ChiRunning Student Athlete Program! This customized 6-week Training Program, powered by Final Surge, will be designed by one of our Master Instructors based on your unique needs. *If you have questions about this program, please call 828.252.9828.

node.title: 10/3/20 | ChiRunning Half-day Workshop | Vince Vaccaro, Joel M, Marie S
node._chi_workshop_additional_date_details: Rain Makeup Date: October 4th
node._chi_workshop_description:
Registration is limited to 18 participants! 

Come learn the basic components of the ChiRunning technique and move well for life! Master Instructor Vince Vaccaro, Master Instructor Joel Matalon, and Certified Instructor Marie Svet will be hosting a Half-day ChiRunning Workshop in Riverside Park on October 3rd. This Workshop will be taught outdoors to abide by social distancing guidelines. You will be taught as a whole group and broken into three smaller groups led by each Instructor for practice.  We will be guiding you through many exercises and drills designed to leave you with a clear sense of what the ChiRunning technique feels like in your body. We will not be doing lots of running (contrary to what you might imagine), so no matter what condition you're in, have no fear. We will spend the day alternating between demonstrations, fun exercises, and technique drills... the nature of the day will be relaxed, full, and inspiring.

If you just need a refresher, check out our Chi Tune-up Sessions that will be held the afternoon of October 3rd at Riverside Park! Tune-up Sessions will be offered for ChiWalking, ChiRunning, and ChiRunning for Better Performance. Registration is limited to 6 people per session!
node._chi_workshop_instr_name: Vince Vaccaro, Joel Matalon, Marie Svet

node.title: 08/15/20 | ChiRunning Half-day Workshop | Matthew O'Connor
node._chi_workshop_additional_date_details: Limited to 4 Participants!!
node._chi_workshop_description:
ChiRunning Half-Day Workshop

ChiRunning technique applies principles from Tai Chi to distance running promoting energy efficiency and injury prevention. How you run dictates how stress goes through your body while running. Efficient running technique affords less stress on your body and requires less effort. Developing efficient running technique is an essential component to restore or sustain your running practice. Efficient ChiRunning Technique can be learned through focused practice. ChiRunning Workshop takes you through 3 steps to start developing the skill of efficient pain-free running: 1) Understand the efficient components of ChiRunning 2) Feel efficient components of ChiRunning in your own body 3) Practice efficient ChiRunning Intro to ChiRunning Workshop will Cover: Principles of Tai Chi applied to distance running Efficient Posture and Alignment Movement of your Dantien (center) to create forward motion ChiWalking- learn to walk before you run ArmSwing- learn an efficient/ productive armswing (Break- Bring you own lunch if you plan on eating during the break) ChiRunning fundamental components and begin to run ChiRunning Gears and Stride Length ChiRunning Cadence Pre-Run Body Looseners Running Video Analysis Intro to ChiRunning Workshop consists of discussion, demonstration, drills and a small amount of running making it perfect for individuals of all conditioning and experience levels interested in efficient running. Class will be limited to 4 participants to allow for individual instruction and social distancing. COVID19 Protocol: The instructor and participants will be required to follow the current recommendations on the date of the workshop. The instructor will contact the participants with the most current recommendations prior to the workshop.

node.title: 09/26/20 | Introduction to ChiRunning | Marc Waxman
node._chi_workshop_description: Great location for a workshop with Master Instructor Marc Waxman. Come learn ChiRunning with an excellent instructor experienced working with runners of all ages and fitness levels!

node.title: 11/21/2020 | ChiRunning Workshop | Petra Freudenberger-Lötz
node._chi_workshop_description:
In diesem 1-Tages-Workshop die Grundlagen des ChiRunnings in Theorie und Praxis gelegt, um sie anschließend im Alltag zu praktizieren. Nach diesem Tag ist jede/r in der Lage, die Vorzüge dieser effizienten und gelenkschonenden Lauftechnik zu genießen. Bei Bedarf können wir auch Einzeltraingseinheiten anschließen, gerne stelle ich euch auch einen Trainingsplan zusammen, der auf eure individuellen Bedürfnisse ausgerichtet ist.
Bitte bringt Laufkleidung und Laufschuhe mit. Ich stelle Getränke und Snacks zur Verfügung. Bei Fragen kontaktiert mich gerne unter petrafreu@web.de. Ich freue mich auf euch.

node.title: 03/20/21 | ChiWalking Clinic | Sarah Richardson
node._chi_workshop_additional_date_details: Easy parking behind the building.
node._chi_workshop_venue: Rise And Shine Running Studio @ Sidewalk Village, Suite 18
node._chi_workshop_description:
The ChiWalking technique applies principles from Tai Chi to recreational walking promoting energy efficiency and injury prevention. How you walk dictates how stress moves through your body while walking. Efficient walking technique distributes less stress on your body and requires less effort. Developing an efficient walking technique is an essential component in restoring or sustaining your walking practice. Efficient ChiWalking Technique can be learned through focused practice. A ChiWalking Clinic takes you through 3 steps to start developing the skill of efficient pain-free walking: 1) Understand the efficient components of ChiWalking 2) Feel efficient components of ChiWalking in your own body 3) Practice efficient ChiWalking Intro to ChiWalking Workshop will Cover:
  • Principles of Tai Chi applied to recreational walking
  • Efficient Posture and Alignment
  • Movement of your Dantien (center) to create forward motion
  • ChiWalking- learn to walk before you run
  • ArmSwing- learn an efficient/ productive arm swing
  • Walking Video Analysis
  • Pre-Walk Body Looseners
  • Core Strengtheners
Intro to ChiWalking Workshop consists of discussion, demonstration, drills and a small amount of walking making it perfect for individuals of all conditioning and experience levels interested in efficient walking. Class will be limited to 4 participants to allow for individual instruction and social distancing. COVID19 Protocol: The instructor and participants will be required to follow the current recommendations on the date of the workshop. The instructor will contact the participants with the most current recommendations prior to the workshop. Notes to participants: We will have a combo of indoor and outdoor time, so please bring appropriate clothing (layers). Feel free to bring water and/or a snack.

node.title: 12/6/20 ChiRunning Workshop Henry Walker
node._chi_workshop_description:
ChiRunning Workshop Description You will get lots of personal attention and enjoy a rich learning experience packed with good information to help you run injury-free for the rest of your life. In this Workshop, you will learn the essential foundation skills for your ChiRunning Technique. I will be guiding you through many exercises and drills designed to leave you with a clear sense of what the ChiRunning technique feels like in your body. We will not be doing lots of running (contrary to what you might imagine), so no matter what condition you are in, have no fear. We will spend time alternating between demonstrations, fun exercises and technique drills ... the nature of the day will be relaxed, full and inspiring.   What you’ll get:
  • The Keys to Effortless, Injury-free Running
  • The Physics of Running: Run without Using Your Legs
  • ChiRunning versus Power Running
  • Introduction to the ChiRunning Form
  • Injury prevention techniques
  • Personal Check-in Tricks and Tools
  • Core Muscle Drills and Exercises
  • Pre-run Body Looseners, Post-run Stretches
  • Innovative technique drills
  • How to conserve energy at any speed
  Please contact me if you have any questions regarding the workshop.

node.title: 01/09/21, Half-day Chi Running Workshop, Ed Malley
node._chi_workshop_description:
This workshop includes a VIDEO GAIT ANALYSIS at the beginning and conclusion of the workshop. Handouts and Ed's detailed analysis by email are also included. Please email Ed at ed@runwalkcoach.com if you have any questions about the workshop or anything running related. Plus...
You will get lots of personal attention and enjoy a rich learning experience packed with good information to help you run with great efficiency and reduce or even eliminate injuries for the rest of your life. In this Workshop, you will learn the essential skills for your ChiRunning Technique. I will be guiding you through many exercises and drills designed to leave you with a clear sense of what the ChiRunning technique feels like in your body. We will not be doing lots of running (contrary to what you might imagine), so no matter what condition you are in, have no fear. We will spend time alternating between demonstrations, fun exercises and technique drills … the nature of the day will be relaxed, fun and inspiring. What you’ll get:
  • The Keys to Efficient, Injury-Eliminating Running
  • The Physics of Running: Run without Using Your Legs
  • ChiRunning versus Power Running
  • Introduction to the ChiRunning Form
  • Injury Prevention Techniques
  • Personal Check-in Tricks and Tools
  • Core Muscle Drills and Exercises
  • Pre-run Body Looseners,
  • Innovative Technique Drills
  • How to Conserve Energy at Any Speed
Please contact me (ed@runwalkcoach.com) if you have any questions regarding the workshop.
node._chi_workshop_testimonialsquote00value: Thanks for the pictures and thanks for the workshop. Was fun, inspirational and very instructive. (After the workshop) I actually went for a 10k run…Came out feeling very refreshed and not sore at all.
node._chi_workshop_testimonialsquote10value: Ed’s training helped me successfully start running again after 25 years. His chi training is superb and his passion for nature and people is contagious.
node._chi_workshop_testimonialsquote20value: Today I did my first Chi long run (a 10-miler) and it felt great! For most of the run I felt like I could keep going forever. When I reached the end, my muscles and joints weren’t fatigued. It was really enjoyable. Thanks again for showing us the light.
node._chi_workshop_testimonialsquote30value: Running pain free for a 55 year old guy with 4 knee surgeries (not running related) is a miracle.

node.title: 2/7/21 | Half Day ChiRunning Workshop | Vince Vaccaro
node._chi_workshop_description:

All Local and State COVID Guidelines will be followed. Participants will be provided a limited edition ChiRunning Buff.

node.title: ChiRunning Half-day Workshop | 2/7/2021 Trent Corey
node._chi_workshop_description:
Does it hurt to run? Want to run more but it's too hard on your body? Do you just want to feel healthy and in shape again? Or are you already running and you want to go faster/farther with less effort? In this course, Doctor of Physical Therapy Trent Corey will instruct you on the mindful process of improving your walking and running form. Feel how much lighter and easier running and walking can be with the right instruction! Learn how to:
  • Reduce Impact/Stress on your Joints
  • Strengthen your Core
  • Focus your Mind
Trent Corey, DPT & Certified Chi-Running Instructor has a passion to help local runners reach their goals and feel great doing it.
Come for fun lessons for walkers and runners in a relaxing, small group atmosphere (max 6 people). There is plenty of room inside a large PT clinic to spread out, and COVID safety will be practiced with sanitizer and masks required. We will go outside for much of the lesson as well, so dress appropriately. All levels are welcome--beginner to advanced!

node._chi_workshop_additional_date_details: Limited to 4 Participants!!
node._chi_workshop_description:
ChiRunning Half-Day Workshop

ChiRunning technique applies principles from Tai Chi to distance running promoting energy efficiency and injury prevention. How you run dictates how stress goes through your body while running. Efficient running technique affords less stress on your body and requires less effort. Developing efficient running technique is an essential component to restore or sustain your running practice. Efficient ChiRunning Technique can be learned through focused practice. ChiRunning Workshop takes you through 3 steps to start developing the skill of efficient pain-free running: 1) Understand the efficient components of ChiRunning 2) Feel efficient components of ChiRunning in your own body 3) Practice efficient ChiRunning Intro to ChiRunning Workshop will Cover: Principles of Tai Chi applied to distance running Efficient Posture and Alignment Movement of your Dantien (center) to create forward motion ChiWalking- learn to walk before you run ArmSwing- learn an efficient/ productive armswing (Break- Bring you own lunch if you plan on eating during the break) ChiRunning fundamental components and begin to run ChiRunning Gears and Stride Length ChiRunning Cadence Pre-Run Body Looseners Running Video Analysis Intro to ChiRunning Workshop consists of discussion, demonstration, drills and a small amount of running making it perfect for individuals of all conditioning and experience levels interested in efficient running. Class will be limited to 4 participants to allow for individual instruction and social distancing. COVID19 Protocol: The instructor and participants will be required to follow the current recommendations on the date of the workshop. The instructor will contact the participants with the most current recommendations prior to the workshop.

The instructor will contact the participants with the most current recommendations prior to those dates.

node.title: 03/20/2021 | ChiRunning Half-day Workshop | Lauren Callahan
node._chi_workshop_description: From beginning runners to ultra marathoners, join Lauren Callahan, Certified ChiRunning and ChiWalking Instructor, to learn this revolutionary approach to effortless, injury-free running. Whether you are coming back from injuries, trying to improve your athletic performance, or are completely new to running, this workshop is for you. This will NOT be what you might expect a typical run workshop to be. There will be no fartleks or intense running drills! Expect a fun, relaxing, positive morning, with incredibly non-scary drills and form focuses that will transform your running into a joyful, lifelong, injury-free practice--it is absolutely possible! Lauren knows firsthand what all ChiRunners know: it is not running that hurts you. It's the WAY you run that hurts you. Let ChiRunning turn your training or fitness routine into a lifelong health and wellness practice--and one that can improve your race performance if that is what you're after! Certified Personal Trainers and other Exercise/Health Professionals: 5 CEC's through ACE available to workshop participants at a $25 additional cost. Certificate will be available for purchase after workshop completion.

node._chi_workshop_testimonialsquote00value: So, I ran my half this morning in 1:57:39 – my second fastest by 20 seconds ( and the fastest was 4 years ago) and Eric said this was the most comfortable half he’s ever run and really benefited from your clinic yesterday. I just wanted you to know that you make an IMMEDIATE difference in people’s health and lives.
node._chi_workshop_testimonialsquote10value: Jeff is an excellent trainer and has transformed me from an uninspired and injury-prone runner into a well rounded athlete with the tools to train and race with ease and joy for years to come. I cannot recommend Jeff and Fitness Delivered enough!

node.title: 12/4/2021 | ChiWalk-Run Workshop | Lisa Holloway
node._chi_workshop_description:
ChiWalk-Run Workshop

You will get lots of personal attention and enjoy a rich learning experience to help you walk, run and walk-run injury-free for the rest of your life. Expand your fitness program with ChiWalk-Run. This workshop provides a unique integration of the ChiWalking and ChiRunning techniques. I will guide you through many exercises and drills designed to leave you with a clear sense of what ChiWalking, ChiRunning and ChiWalk-Run feel like in your body. There will be some walking, running and walk-running, but only enough to learn the basics and foundations of these approaches – a relaxed, full and inspiring day! The ChiWalk-Run workshop is perfect for walkers who want to introduce running into their fitness program, beginner runners, or those returning to running from an injury or hiatus. What you’ll get: • Keys to effortless, injury-free walking and running • Basics of the holistic, integrated ChiWalk-Run approach • Core muscle and technique drills and exercises • Upper and lower body usage in walking and running, e.g., running without using your legs and the role of gravity. • Introduction to ChiWalking and ChiRunning form • Energy conservation in movement • Body scanning, awareness and choice when walking or running • Tips for transitions between walking and running; when to do which and how to make the shift most efficiently
Please contact me if you have any questions regarding the workshop.
All workshop participants get FREE access to The Run Show USA in Boston using the code: CHIRUNNING at checkout

node.title: 4/25/2021 | ChiWalk-Run Workshop | Amy Peacock
node._chi_workshop_description:
ChiWalk-Run Workshop

You will get lots of personal attention and enjoy a rich learning experience to help you walk, run and walk-run injury-free for the rest of your life. Expand your fitness program with ChiWalk-Run.
In this introductory class, you will learn the form and philosophy behind ChiWalking so you can begin to walk and even run with better form to prevent injury, be more energy efficient, and come back safely after an injury.  As a result of this class and practicing what you learn, you will also have more fun walking and running.
Please contact me if you have any questions regarding the workshop.

node.title: 5/22/21 | ChiRunning Half-day Workshop | Jean Gillis
node._chi_workshop_description:
ChiRunning Half-Day Workshop

ChiRunning technique applies principles from Tai Chi to distance running promoting energy efficiency and injury prevention. How you run dictates how stress goes through your body while running. Efficient running technique affords less stress on your body and requires less effort. Developing efficient running technique is an essential component to restore or sustain your running practice. Efficient ChiRunning Technique can be learned through focused practice. ChiRunning Workshop takes you through 3 steps to start developing the skill of efficient pain-free running: 1) Understand the efficient components of ChiRunning 2) Feel efficient components of ChiRunning in your own body 3) Practice efficient ChiRunning Intro to ChiRunning Workshop will Cover: Principles of Tai Chi applied to distance running Efficient Posture and Alignment Movement of your Dantien (center) to create forward motion ChiWalking- learn to walk before you run Arm Swing- learn an efficient/ productive arm swing (Break- Bring you own lunch if you plan on eating during the break) ChiRunning fundamental components and begin to run ChiRunning Gears and Stride Length ChiRunning Cadence Pre-Run Body Looseners Running Video Analysis Intro to ChiRunning Workshop consists of discussion, demonstration, drills and a small amount of running making it perfect for individuals of all conditioning and experience levels interested in efficient running.   COVID19 Protocol: The instructor and participants will be required to follow the current recommendations on the date of the workshop. The instructor will contact the participants with the most current recommendations prior to the workshop.

node.title: 7/17/2021 | ChiWalking Workshop | Lisa Holloway
node._chi_workshop_description:
ChiWalking Workshop

  In this workshop you will learn the essential foundation skills for your ChiWalking Technique. I will be guiding you through many exercises and drills designed to leave you with a clear sense of what the ChiWalking technique feels like in your body. We won't be doing a lot of walking. The focus will be on building a solid base of knowledge that you will carry forward in your walking program. You'll get lots of personal attention and enjoy a rich learning experience packed with good information to help you walk in balance for the rest of your life. Create balance in your body and yourself with ChiWalking. ChiWalking will teach you to move from your center, your core, and not use your legs to walk!! You'll learn proper body alignment and movement techniques that will give you a powerful sense of balance and stability, as well as relaxation and spaciousness in your body and mind. What you'll get:
  • Introduction to the ChiWalking method
  • Injury-prevention techniques
  • Core muscle drills and exercises
  • Upper body and lower body usage
  • Personal check-in tricks and tools
  • Innovative technique drills
  • How to relax and conserve energy at any walking speed
Please contact me if you have any questions regarding the workshop. COVID19 Protocol: The instructor and participants will be required to follow the current recommendations on the dates of in-person sessions. The instructor will contact the participants with the most current recommendations prior to those dates.

node.title: 8/14/2021 | ChiWalk-Run Workshop | Lisa Holloway
node._chi_workshop_description:
ChiWalk-Run Workshop

You will get lots of personal attention and enjoy a rich learning experience to help you walk, run and walk-run injury-free for the rest of your life. Expand your fitness program with ChiWalk-Run. This workshop provides a unique integration of the ChiWalking and ChiRunning techniques. I will guide you through many exercises and drills designed to leave you with a clear sense of what ChiWalking, ChiRunning and ChiWalk-Run feel like in your body. There will be some walking, running and walk-running, but only enough to learn the basics and foundations of these approaches – a relaxed, full and inspiring day! The ChiWalk-Run workshop is perfect for walkers who want to introduce running into their fitness program, beginner runners, or those returning to running from an injury or hiatus. What you’ll get:
  • Keys to effortless, injury-free walking and running
  • Basics of the holistic, integrated ChiWalk-Run approach
  • Core muscle and technique drills and exercises
  • Upper and lower body usage in walking and running, e.g., running without using your legs and the role of gravity
  • Introduction to ChiWalking and ChiRunning form
  • Energy conservation in movement
  • Body scanning, awareness and choice when walking or running
  • Tips for transitions between walking and running; when to do which and how to make the shift most efficiently
Please contact me if you have any questions regarding the workshop.

node.title: 8/21/2021 | Half-day ChiRunning Workshop | Lisa Holloway
node._chi_workshop_description:
ChiRunning Workshop Workshop Description -  You will get lots of personal attention and enjoy a rich learning experience packed with good information to help you run injury-free for the rest of your life. In this Workshop, you will learn the essential foundation skills for your ChiRunning Technique. I will be guiding you through many exercises and drills designed to leave you with a clear sense of what the ChiRunning technique feels like in your body. We will not be doing lots of running (contrary to what you might imagine), so no matter what condition you are in, have no fear. We will spend time alternating between demonstrations, fun exercises and technique drills ... the nature of the day will be relaxed, full and inspiring. What you'll get:
  • The Keys to Effortless, Injury-free Running
  • The Physics of Running: Run without Using Your Legs
  • ChiRunning versus Power Running
  • Introduction to the ChiRunning Form
  • Injury prevention techniques
  • Personal Check-In Tricks & Tools
  • Core Muscle Drills and Exercises
  • Pre-run Body Looseners, Post-run Stretches
  • Innovative technique drills
  • How to conserve energy at any speed
Please contact me if you have any questions regarding the workshop.

node.title: 10/16/2021 | ChiWalking Workshop | Lisa Holloway
node._chi_workshop_description:
ChiWalking Workshop

  In this workshop you will learn the essential foundation skills for your ChiWalking Technique. I will be guiding you through many exercises and drills designed to leave you with a clear sense of what the ChiWalking technique feels like in your body. We won't be doing a lot of walking. The focus will be on building a solid base of knowledge that you will carry forward in your walking program. You'll get lots of personal attention and enjoy a rich learning experience packed with good information to help you walk in balance for the rest of your life. Create balance in your body and yourself with ChiWalking. ChiWalking will teach you to move from your center, your core, and not use your legs to walk!! You'll learn proper body alignment and movement techniques that will give you a powerful sense of balance and stability, as well as relaxation and spaciousness in your body and mind. What you'll get:
  • Introduction to the ChiWalking method
  • Injury-prevention techniques
  • Core muscle drills and exercises
  • Upper body and lower body usage
  • Personal check-in tricks and tools
  • Innovative technique drills
  • How to relax and conserve energy at any walking speed
Please contact me if you have any questions regarding the workshop. COVID19 Protocol: The instructor and participants will be required to follow the current recommendations on the dates of in-person sessions. The instructor will contact the participants with the most current recommendations prior to those dates. All workshop participants get FREE access to The Run Show USA in Boston using the code: CHIRUNNING at checkout

This two hour workshop is designed for people who are familiar with the basics of ChiRunning, regardless of your level, from beginners to advanced runners. This workshop will be outside. node._chi_workshop_description:
ChiWalking

Create balance in your body and yourself with ChiWalking by learning to move from your center and not use your legs to walk. You’ll learn proper body alignment and movement techniques that will give you a powerful sense of balance and stability, as well as relaxation and spaciousness in your body and mind. In this workshop I will be guiding you through a series of drills designed to leave you with a clear sense of what the ChiWalking technique feels like in your body. We will follow this with a walk down the beautiful West Boylston Rail Trail along the Quinapoxet River. The focus will be on building a solid base of knowledge that you will carry forward in your walking program. You’ll get lots of personal attention and enjoy a rich learning experience packed with good information to help you walk in balance for the rest of your life.
