node.title: 05/29/2021 | ChiRunning Half-day Workshop | Lisa Pozzoni
node._chi_workshop_description:
ChiRunning Half Day Workshop

Learn the components of ChiRunning technique so running can be easy and pain free! In this fun 4 hours, we will guide you through drills designed to leave you with a clear sense of what the ChiRunning technique feels like in your body. Learn: Posture, Foot Placement, How to Move from Your Center (not using legs), Arm Swing, Circular Stride, Stride Length and Cadence. All levels are welcome! We will video participants at the beginning to ensure we cover your issues. COVID precautions will be taken. Class co-taught by Master Instructor Lisa Pozzoni & Certified Instructor Henry Walker

node._chi_workshop_name: Intro to ChiRunning with 2020 ChiRunning Instructor of the Year
node.title: 6/19/21 | Intro to ChiRunning | Marc Waxman
node._chi_workshop_venue: Active Recovery Boston in Franklin, MA (Great location!)
node._chi_workshop_description:
Active Recovery Boston (ARB) is excited to announce that the ChiRunning 2020 Instructor of the Year, Marc Waxman, will offer an Introduction to ChiRunning Workshop at ARB’s new location.

When: June 19 from 9 AM – 1 PM Where: ARB in Franklin - 82 Emmons St, Franklin, MA 02038 What: Join Master ChiRunning Instructor Marc Waxman for a 4-hour session focused on the fundamentals of ChiRunning. Through modeling, drills, and real-time feedback Marc will support participants in learning how to access the deep power reserves of their core muscles and “move from the middle” with a technique that leads to comfortable and efficient movement. Topics include using the forces of nature (and not your muscles!) to move, establishing a consistent cadence while running, increasing your pace through relaxation, efficiently navigating hill running, and much more. Why: Your body will thank you for the time you spend learning ChiRunning! Who: The workshop is designed for individuals of all conditioning and experience levels interested inefficient running, whether you are an experienced runner, taking up running for the first time, or anywhere in between.

node.title: 06/19/21 | ChiRunning Clinic | Sarah Richardson
node._chi_workshop_additional_date_details: Easy parking behind the building (No Meter Payment on Weekends!!!!)
node._chi_workshop_venue: Rise And Shine Running Studio @ Sidewalk Village, Suite 18
node._chi_workshop_description:
The ChiRunning technique applies principles from Tai Chi to distance running promoting energy efficiency and injury prevention. How you run dictates how stress goes through your body while running. Efficient running technique affords less stress on your body and requires less effort. Developing efficient running technique is an essential component to restore or sustain your running practice. Efficient ChiRunning Technique can be learned through focused practice. A ChiRunning Clinic takes you through 3 steps to start developing the skill of efficient pain-free running: 1) Understand the efficiency of ChiRunning 2) Feel the efficiency of ChiRunning in your own body 3) Guided Practice of ChiRunning

>>>You will also receive a full video analysis of your running technique<<<

Intro to ChiRunning Workshop will Cover:
  • Principles of Tai Chi applied to distance running
  • Efficient Posture and Alignment
  • Movement of your Dantien (center) to create forward motion
  • ChiWalking- learn to walk before you run
  • ArmSwing- learn an efficient/ productive arm swing
  • ChiRunning fundamentals & beginning to run
  • ChiRunning Gears and Stride Length
  • ChiRunning Cadence
  • Running Video Analysis
  • Pre-Run Body Looseners
  • Core Strengtheners
Intro to ChiRunning Workshop consists of discussion, demonstration, drills and a small amount of running making it perfect for individuals of all conditioning and experience levels interested in efficient running. Class will be limited to 4 participants to allow for individual instruction and social distancing. COVID19 Protocol: The instructor and participants will be required to follow the current recommendations on the date of the workshop. The instructor will contact the participants with the most current recommendations prior to the workshop. Notes to participants: We will have a combo of indoor and outdoor time, so please bring appropriate clothing (layers). Feel free to bring water, light lunch and/or a snack.

node.title: 6/19/2021 | ChiRunning / ChiWalking Half Day Workshop | Joel Matalon
node._chi_workshop_description: RUNhabX™ = Runner’s Habits for Extraordinary Living brings to you the world's finest coaching and training for the runner, walker and anyone desiring to move well. Whether you are coming back from injuries, trying to improve your athletic performance, or are a novice, this clinic is for you.  Learn the fundamentals & mechanics of running/walking more efficiently and pain-free. Anticipate a renewed love for health in a relaxing, interactive and positive atmosphere. Customized drills and form focused exercises will transform your walking/running into a joyful, lifelong, injury-free practice……Have some Run! This clinic will feature Animalogy™, the study / investigation / experience of YOUR specific Tai Chi animal. This drill will teach you how to become skilled at increasing your untapped energy with a guarantee to keep a smile on your face. The clinic is held outdoors with limited attendance for safety and plenty of personal attention.  Masks are mandatory. Certified Personal Trainers, Life Coaches, Coaches, Educators and other Allied Exercise/Health Professionals: 5 CECs via (ACE)  American Council on Exercise.  (Additional $25. node._chi_workshop_name: 6 Week Virtual ChiWalking/ChiRunning and Nutrition Foundation
node.title: 08/01- 09/11/21 | 6 Week Virtual ChiWalking / ChiRunning and Nutrition Foundation Workshop | Shannon Smith
node._chi_workshop_additional_date_details: 6 week virtual workshop with live classes Sundays at 7:00 pm EDT and Q&A sessions Wednesdays at 7:00 pm EDT. All sessions will be recorded if you can't make it!
node._chi_workshop_description:
Learn the most common reasons why you are stuck in weight loss and the keys to getting fit, strong, and healthy. Learn how to move without pain, eat without starving, and find balance in your life. This 6-week virtual workshop will teach you the foundations of ChiWalking/ ChiRunning and the basics of a healthy nutrition plan. Acquire the skills to learn how to improve your body alignment for optimal efficiency and less impact to your joints along with techniques for preventing pain. Understand simple, balanced real food solutions that fit into your life and how to use food to fuel your body. In this workshop you will get:
  • Weekly live classes to dive into exactly what is needed for your movement and nutrition plan.
  • A chance to get your questions answered by your coaches in a live Q&A session to help guide you through the workshop.
  • Weekly nutrition and movement focus.
  • A weekly challenge to complete.
  • Optional Facebook group for support, community, and accountability.
  • Chance to win a weekly prize

node.title: 07/10/21 | ChiRunning Clinic | Sarah Richardson

node._chi_workshop_description:
The ChiRunning technique applies principles from Tai Chi to distance running promoting energy efficiency and injury prevention. How you run dictates how stress goes through your body while running. Efficient running technique affords less stress on your body and requires less effort. Developing efficient running technique is an essential component to restore or sustain your running practice. Efficient ChiRunning Technique can be learned through focused practice. A ChiRunning Clinic takes you through 3 steps to start developing the skill of efficient pain-free running: 1) Understand the efficiency of ChiRunning 2) Feel the efficiency of ChiRunning in your own body 3) Guided Practice of ChiRunning

>>>You will also receive a full video analysis of your running technique<<<

Intro to ChiRunning Workshop will Cover:
  • Principles of Tai Chi applied to distance running

node._chi_workshop_name: Multi-day ChiWalking & ChiRunning Workshop at Omega Institute
node.title: 08/03-08/08 | ChiWalking & ChiRunning Multiday Workshop
node._chi_workshop_description:
Walking and running can bring joy and inner peace into your life when you optimize your technique, mindset, and lifestyle, transforming your exercise into a moving meditation. Join co-owners of ChiLiving, Sarah Richardson and Lisa Pozzoni, as they share the Chi principles that bring efficiency and ease to walking and running. You learn to connect with your body and discover the joy and meditative qualities walking and running can bring to your life. The Chi principles will help you feel clear, open, and relaxed not just when you walk or run, but all day long. Immerse yourself in:
  • Deep body sensing
  • Intelligent movement from your center
  • Mind-body connection and exploration in nature
  • Alignment and relaxation while walking and running
  • Self-gratitude practices
Return home with a new relationship with your walking or running routine, a toolbox of forms to ground you in your body, and a mindful movement practice that will bring you joy, inner peace, and improved well-being for life.
node._chi_workshop_instr_name: Master Instructors Sarah Richardson & Lisa Pozzoni

node.title: 07/10/21 | Half Day ChiRunning Clinic | Emer O Brien
node._chi_workshop_description: Chi Running technique will help you run more efficiently, reduce the risk of injury and improve your performance. This workshop will include video observation with a focus on posture, breathing, cadence, stride length, arm swing, plus how to tackle those dreaded hills with ease! My aim is to help you move better, run better and compete better. Suitable for all runners. seasoned racers, triathletes, recreational runners and beginners. Also suitable for those of you who play sport and running is part of your fitness routine. Social distancing and proper hygiene practices will be adhered to at all times. Looking forward to seeing you there.

node.title: 7/17/2021 | ChiRunning and ChiWalking Essentials | Amy Peacock
node._chi_workshop_description: This is an introduction to the ChiRunning and ChiWalking essentials and techniques. You will learn how to run and walk with more energy and less chance of injury. You will leave class with tips to immediately enhance your running, walking, and exercising. And, how to come back safely and faster post-injury. This is a great time to learn this for your training, any races in the fall, and of course, your everyday running and walking.

node.title: 8/14/2021 | ChiWalking Workshop| Laurel Flax
node._chi_workshop_additional_date_details: This will be a small group, indoor venue, we will also be going outside, weather permitting.
node._chi_workshop_description:
In this workshop, you will learn the essential foundation skills for your ChiWalking Technique so that you can walk easily & efficiently without fear of injury and develop a lifelong practice of movement! ChiWalking is based on the movement principles of T'ai Chi. An efficient walking technique affords less stress on your body and requires less effort. I will be guiding you through many exercises and drills designed to leave you with a clear sense of what the ChiWalking technique feels like in your body. We won’t be doing a lot of walking. The focus will be on building a solid base of knowledge that you will carry forward in your walking program. You’ll get lots of personal attention and enjoy a rich learning experience packed with good information to help you walk in balance for the rest of your life. Create balance in your body and yourself with ChiWalking. ChiWalking will teach you to move from your center, your core, and not use your legs to walk!! You’ll learn proper body alignment and movement techniques that will give you a powerful sense of balance and stability, as well as relaxation and spaciousness in your body and mind. What you’ll get:
  • Principles of Tai Chi applied to Walking
  • Efficient Posture and Alignment
  • Movement of your Dantien (center) to create forward motion
  • Introduction to the ChiWalking method
  • Upper body and lower body usage
  • Injury-prevention techniques
  • Core muscle drills and exercises
  • Body Looseners
  • Personal check-in tricks and tools
  • How to relax and conserve energy at any walking speed
Since we are in the Training Center, it will be possible for participants to bring quiet, well-behaved dogs. We will spend a few minutes at the end of the workshop practicing walking our dogs and doing slow/fast/normal pace transitions using ChiWalking technique. You may bring a crate or ex-pen or use a guest crate at the facility. Proof of rabies vaccination for dogs is required. Monadnock Humane Society also has some lovely trails that you can walk your dog on before or after the workshop. Monadnock Humane Society Training Center is a large air-conditioned space with excellent matting on the floor!! We may also go outside to work on a few small hills. The Shelter itself will be closed and we will have access to the bathrooms. Currently, the Shelter is only adopting animals by appointment - if you would like to investigate adoption, please check their website https://monadnockhumanesociety.org/ and make an appointment after the workshop. Please contact me if you have any questions regarding the workshop at AlignEngageGo@gmail.com COVID19 Protocol: The instructor and participants will be required to follow the current recommendations on the dates of in-person sessions. The instructor will contact the participants with the most current recommendations prior to those dates.
node._chi_workshop_testimonialsquote00value: It was a pleasure to attend Laurel’s Chi Walk instruction. She illustrates concepts clearly and creates excitement about learning to move functionally to prevent injury! I highly recommend her classes.

node.title: 9/04/21 | ChiRunning Half Day Workshop | Lauren Callahan
node._chi_workshop_description:
From beginning runners to ultra marathoners, join Lauren Callahan, Certified ChiRunning and ChiWalking Instructor, to learn this revolutionary approach to effortless, injury-free running. Whether you are coming back from injuries, trying to improve your athletic performance, or are completely new to running, this workshop is for you.
This will NOT be what you might expect a typical run workshop to be. There will be no fartleks or intense running drills! Expect a fun, relaxing, positive morning, with incredibly non-scary drills and form focuses that will transform your running into a joyful, lifelong, injury-free practice–it is absolutely possible!
Let ChiRunning turn your training or fitness routine into a lifelong health and wellness practice–and one that can improve your race performance if that is what you’re after!
Certified Personal Trainers and other Exercise/Health Professionals: 5 CEC’s through ACE available to workshop participants at a $25 additional cost. A certificate will be available for purchase after workshop completion.

What you’ll get: The Keys to Effortless, Injury-free Running The Physics of Running: Run without Using Your Legs ChiRunning versus Power Running Introduction to the ChiRunning Form Injury prevention techniques Personal Check-In Tricks & Tools Core Muscle Drills and Exercises Pre-run Body Looseners, Post-run Stretches Innovative technique drills How to conserve energy at any speed Please contact me if you have any questions regarding the workshop. node.title: 9/16/21 | Free ChiRunning/ChiWalking Clinic | Lisa Pozzoni
node._chi_workshop_description:
In this clinic, I will introduce the ChiWalking/ChiRunning form. Walking and running are one of the best ways to lose weight and stay fit.
Most people walk and run by using the muscles in their legs. As a result, people lead with their legs and pull themselves forward (most walking and running injuries are mainly due to improper use of leg muscles!)
ChiRunning/ChiWalking teaches you to use your core muscles rather than your leg muscles, allowing your upper body to lead your lower body. This forward movement engages the pull of gravity, which then becomes your ally. This revolutionary method uses the same principles of T’ai Chi by working with core muscles, body alignment, and body/mind integration resulting in a proven pain-free, energy-efficient way to walk and run.
This, in turn, creates a more focused and enjoyable workout experience for lifelong health and energy.
It’s great for all fitness levels! If you are a beginner, you will learn the right technique before doing it incorrectly. For experienced walkers or runners, find out how you can take your performance to the next level. If you are injured, find out what you are doing incorrectly so you can get back to the sport you love.
Visit www.ChiWalking.com or www.ChiRunning.com for more information.

node.title: 10/30/2021 | ChiRunning 4hr Workshop | Henry Walker
node._chi_workshop_description: Learn the components of ChiRunning technique so running can be easy and pain free! In this fun 4 hours, we will guide you through drills designed to leave you with a clear sense of what the ChiRunning technique feels like in your body. Have you ever learned how to run? Seems pretty basic to put one foot in front of the other...yet 65% of runners are injured every year and most people find running hard. It's not running that causes pain, but HOW you run. Running is not hard but HOW you run makes it hard. Learn: Posture, Foot Placement, How to Move from Your Center (not using legs), Arm Swing, Circular Stride, Stride Length and Cadence. All levels are welcome! We will video participants at the beginning to ensure we cover your issues. COVID precautions will be taken. Class co-taught by Master Instructor Lisa Pozzoni and Certified Instructor Henry Walker / $ ! All workshop participants get FREE access to The Run Show USA in Boston using the code: CHIRUNNING at checkout

  • 4:30pmpm Melbourne,
  • 5:30pm Sydney, Melbourne
  • 7:30pm New Zealand
Atul and I will talk you through the essentials of good running technique. These will be recorded so that if you miss a session, you can watch the recording. You will also be given free access to our Mighty Network for 1 year where you can review the Lesson plans of both the Body Challenge and Chi Running Essentials for an entire year and also be part of a world-wide running community. Whether its a 5K, a half or full marathon or an ultra, this virtual techniques training session is for you! Sign up below. The cost is A$199/ NZ$199 https://www.chirunning.com/online-chirunning-chiwalking-community/ Also, to keep informed of our next sessions, follow us on Facebook and Instagram to keep updated, as we add more workshops throughout Australia and New Zealand. We will not be doing lots of running (contrary to what you might imagine), so no matter what condition you are in, have no fear. We will spend time alternating between demonstrations, fun exercises and technique drills ... the nature of the day will be relaxed, full and inspiring. What you’ll get:
  • The Keys to Effortless, Injury-free Running
  • The Physics of Running: Run without Using Your Legs
  • ChiRunning versus Power Running
  • Introduction to the ChiRunning Form
  • Injury prevention techniques
  • Personal Check-in Tricks and Tools
  • Core Muscle Drills and Exercises

node.title: 4/23/2022 | ChiWalking Half-day Workshop | Lisa Holloway
node._chi_workshop_description:
ChiWalking Workshop In this workshop you will learn the essential foundation skills for your ChiWalking Technique. I will be guiding you through many exercises and drills designed to leave you with a clear sense of what the ChiWalking technique feels like in your body. We won't be doing a lot of walking. The focus will be on building a solid base of knowledge that you will carry forward in your walking program. You'll get lots of personal attention and enjoy a rich learning experience packed with good information to help you walk in balance for the rest of your life. Create balance in your body and yourself with ChiWalking. ChiWalking will teach you to move from your center, your core, and not use your legs to walk!! You'll learn proper body alignment and movement techniques that will give you a powerful sense of balance and stability, as well as relaxation and spaciousness in your body and mind. What you'll get:
  • Introduction to the ChiWalking method
  • Injury-prevention techniques
  • Core muscle drills and exercises
  • Upper body and lower body usage
  • Personal check-in tricks and tools
  • Innovative technique drills
  • How to relax and conserve energy at any walking speed
  • Handouts of all the material covered in the workshop
Please contact me if you have any questions regarding the workshop.

node._chi_workshop_name: The Run Show USA - Endurance through Technique
node.title: 1/29/22 | Endurance through Technique (11:00 AM-12:45 PM EST) | Run Show Boston - Danny Dreyer
node._chi_workshop_additional_date_details: Limited to 10 participants. Registration includes FREE admission ($15.00 value) to the Run Show USA - Boston
node._chi_workshop_venue: Hynes Convention Center / In Prudential Center
node._chi_workshop_description:
The true secret to becoming a good endurance athlete, surprisingly, isn’t in being stronger than your competitors... it’s being smarter and wiser. Success comes to the athlete who adapts quickly and effectively to the constantly changing conditions of his or her event. Excelling at endurance involves having a running technique that is not static and not dependent predominantly on the legs, but a fluid movement using the whole body. Many runners learn the hard way that running uphill, or into the wind, requires a different running technique than running on flat ground. The most efficient runners constantly monitor their energy expenditure and adjust accordingly to create the highest output with the least amount of effort. Knowing when to take advantage of downhills and when to relax and rest on the run is also a great skill to have. That’s only one aspect of what you’ll learn in this highly informative workshop led by ChiRunning founder, Danny Dreyer, a seasoned ultramarathoner and running coach for over twenty years. Here is some of what you’ll learn in this experiential seminar:
  • What you can do to become a truly efficient runner
  •  The importance of “Whole-body” running
  •  How posture creates greater efficiency
  •  Do’s and Don’ts of endurance running
    Please contact Master Instructor Vince Vaccaro if you have any questions regarding the clinic.

node._chi_workshop_name: The Run Show USA - Endurance through Technique
node.title: 1/30/22 | Endurance through Technique (11:00 AM-12:45 PM) | Run Show Boston - Danny Dryer
node._chi_workshop_additional_date_details: Limited to 10 participants. Registration includes FREE admission ($15.00 value) to the Run Show USA - Boston
node._chi_workshop_venue: Hynes Convention Center / In Prudential Center

node.title: 02/13/22 | ChiRunning Clinic | Sarah Richardson
node._chi_workshop_additional_date_details: Easy parking behind the building (No Meter Payment on Weekends!!!!)
node._chi_workshop_venue: Rise And Shine Running Studio @ Sidewalk Village, Suite 18
node._chi_workshop_description:
The ChiRunning technique applies principles from Tai Chi to distance running promoting energy efficiency and injury prevention. How you run dictates how stress goes through your body while running. Efficient running technique affords less stress on your body and requires less effort. Developing efficient running technique is an essential component to restore or sustain your running practice. Efficient ChiRunning Technique can be learned through focused practice. A ChiRunning Clinic takes you through 3 steps to start developing the skill of efficient pain-free running: 1) Understand the efficiency of ChiRunning 2) Feel the efficiency of ChiRunning in your own body 3) Guided Practice of ChiRunning

>>>You will also receive a full video analysis of your running technique<<<

Intro to ChiRunning Workshop will Cover:
  • Principles of Tai Chi applied to distance running
  • Efficient Posture and Alignment
  • Movement of your Dantien (center) to create forward motion
  • ChiWalking- learn to walk before you run
  • ArmSwing- learn an efficient/ productive arm swing
  • ChiRunning fundamentals & beginning to run
  • ChiRunning Gears and Stride Length
  • ChiRunning Cadence
  • Running Video Analysis
  • Pre-Run Body Looseners
  • Core Strengtheners
Intro to ChiRunning Workshop consists of discussion, demonstration, drills and a small amount of running making it perfect for individuals of all conditioning and experience levels interested in efficient running. Class will be limited to 6 participants to allow for individual instruction. COVID19 Protocol: The instructor and participants will be required to follow the current recommendations on the date of the workshop. The instructor will contact the participants with the most current recommendations prior to the workshop. Notes to participants: We will have a combo of indoor and outdoor time, so please bring appropriate clothing (layers). Feel free to bring water, light lunch and/or a snack.

node.title: 1/29/22 | ChiRunning Tune-Up | Run Show Boston (12:15-1:00 PM EST)
node._chi_workshop_additional_date_details: Limited to 10 participants. Registration includes FREE admission ($15.00 value) to the Run Show USA - Boston
node._chi_workshop_venue: Hynes Convention Center / In Prudential Center
node._chi_workshop_description:
The ChiRunning Tune-Up is perfect for ChiRunners of all abilities. Revisit form focuses of the Chi Running technique. ChiRunning is a practice designed to improve your running performance. Like all practices, at times a refresher is needed. This 45 minute Tune-Up, will take place at the ChiRunning area within the expo. It is designed to review the basic components of the ChiRunning technique. Our New England team of Certified ChiRunning Instructors will refresh your practice of ChiRunning exciting you to begin Spring training. node._chi_workshop_name: The Run Show USA - Form Focus Run
node.title: 1/30/22 | ChiRunning Form Focus 5K | Run Show Boston (7:00-7:45 PM EST)
node._chi_workshop_additional_date_details: Registration includes FREE admission ($15.00 value) to the Run Show USA - Boston
node._chi_workshop_venue: Hynes Convention Center / In Prudential Center
node._chi_workshop_description:
Join us for a Form Focus Run! Join Danny and the New England ChiRunning Instructors warm up for the Run Show with a fun run along the Charles River. This is the perfect time to visit with your favorite group of instructors while revisiting the basic components of the Chi Running technique. Once you register you will receive directions to our meeting location. We will be the group of runners doing body looseners before beginning our easy run. The run is designed for technique and open to runners of all abilities and speed.  
  • Please contact Master Instructor Vince Vaccaro if you have any questions regarding the clinic.

node._chi_workshop_name: The Run Show USA - ChiRunning Clinic
node.title: 1/30/22 | ChiRunning Clinic | Run Show Boston (9:00-10:45 AM)
node._chi_workshop_additional_date_details: Limited to 10 participants. Registration includes FREE admission ($15.00 value) to the Run Show USA - Boston
node._chi_workshop_venue: Hynes Convention Center / In Prudential Center
node._chi_workshop_description:
New to ChiRunning, join us for a Run Show Clinic. Learn the basic components of the Chi Running technique. ChiRunning is designed to improve your running performance while reducing your chance of injury and increasing your energy efficiency. The result is confidence, speed, and distance with less effort. This 1.75-hour clinic, will take place at the ChiRunning area within the expo. It will cover the basic components of ChiRunning to help you move across every finish line. Our New England team of Certified ChiRunning Instructors will guide you through exercises and drills designed to leave you with a clear sense of what the ChiRunning technique feels like in your body. We will not be doing lots of running, so no matter what condition you're in, have no fear. We will spend our time alternating between demonstrations, fun exercises and technique drills... the nature of the clinic will be relaxed, full, and inspiring.
  • Please contact Master Instructor Vince Vaccaro if you have any questions regarding the clinic.

node.title: 11/28/2021 | 1/2 day ChiRunning Workshop | Michael Weintraub
node._chi_workshop_additional_date_details: Prepare for your winter training, stay healthy and run safely
node._chi_workshop_description:
ChiRunning Half-Day Workshop Are you looking to get a jump start on your winter training, to stay healthy throughout the season, perhaps pick up a few tips for running in the cold and snow? Join our November 28th ChiRunning Workshop in Brookline, and start your off-season training by focusing on improving efficiency and avoiding injury! Whether an advanced runner or a beginner, you will learn the essential foundation skills for your ChiRunning Technique. I will be guiding you through many exercises and drills designed to leave you with a clear sense of what the ChiRunning technique feels like in your body. We will not be doing lots of running (contrary to what you might imagine), so no matter what condition you are in, have no fear. We will spend time alternating between demonstrations, fun exercises and technique drills … the nature of the day will be relaxed, fun and inspiring. Intro to ChiRunning Workshop will Cover
  • Principles of T’ai Chi applied to running
  • Efficient Posture and Alignment
  • The Physics of Running: Run without Using Your Legs
  • Movement of your Dantien (center) to create forward motion
  • ChiWalking- learn to walk before you run
  • Arm Swing- learn an efficient/ productive arm swing
  • ChiRunning fundamental components and begin to run
  • ChiRunning Gears and Stride Length
  • ChiRunning Cadence
All workshop participants get FREE access to The Run Show USA in Boston using the code: CHIRUNNING at checkout COVID19 Protocol: The instructor and participants will be required to follow the current recommendations on the date of the workshop. The instructor will contact the participants with the most current recommendations prior to the workshop. Currently, the indoor portion of the workshop will require face masks.

node._chi_workshop_name: ChiWalking Weekend with Co-founder Katherine Dreyer
node.title: 05/19/22 ChiWalking Weekend Katherine Dreyer
1/1/2022 | Wachusett Winter ChiWalkers Club | Shannon Smith
node._chi_workshop_additional_date_details: Join us Saturdays from January thru March! All money raised will go to The CASA Project - helping abused and neglected children in Worcester County. https://www.thecasaproject.org/
node._chi_workshop_description:
Stay motivated to move through the winter! Join the Wachusett Winter ChiWalkers Saturday mornings on the rail trails and parks around Worcester County from January thru March. Join us for one Saturday, a couple of Saturdays, or every Saturday for $5 per walk.
100% of all money raised will go to The CASA Project to help abused and neglected children in Worcester County. https://www.thecasaproject.org/
Additional information will be shared upon registration.

node.title: 02/13/2022 | Heart Healthy ChiWalking Clinic | Shannon Smith
node._chi_workshop_additional_date_details: INDOOR Location
node._chi_workshop_description: Learn how you can use ChiWalking to strengthen your heart, reduce stress, and re-energize your body! Gone are the days of "no pain, no gain", rather here is an approach to get curious about what your body is telling you, build on gradual progress, and be kind to your heart. We’ll create sustainable routines that work for your lifestyle and leave you feeling energized, not exhausted. ChiWalking is a technique that uses alignment and relaxation to allow you to walk pain free with more efficiency. Learn the basic components of the ChiWalking technique and move well for life! In this series, you will be guided through many exercises and drills designed to leave you with a clear sense of what the ChiWalking technique feels like in your body. We will spend time alternating between demonstrations, fun exercises, and technique drills - the nature of the day will be relaxed, fun, and inspiring. Beneficial for walkers to beginner runners all the way to ultra marathoners. This session is for day 1 of a 2 day clinic. You can choose to only participate in the first day, learning about ChiWalking and heart rate training. Or, for an additional cost, you can choose to join us for day 2 and learn the basics of the ChiRunning technique plus advanced techniques for breathing, running uphill, and running downhill. Venue: Ultimate Obstacles

node.title: 2/13 & 2/27/2022 | ChiWalking & ChiRunning 2 Day Clinic | Shannon Smith
node._chi_workshop_additional_date_details: INDOOR Location - 2 Day Clinic. One clinic happening 2/13, the next happening 2/27.
node._chi_workshop_description: Learn how you can use ChiWalking and ChiRunning to strengthen your heart, reduce stress, and re-energize your body! Gone are the days of "no pain, no gain", rather here is an approach to get curious about what your body is telling you, build on gradual progress, and be kind to your heart. We’ll create sustainable routines that work for your lifestyle and leave you feeling energized, not exhausted. ChiRunning is a technique that uses alignment and relaxation to allow you to walk or run pain free with more efficiency. Learn the basic components of the ChiRunning technique and move well for life! In this series, you will be guided through many exercises and drills designed to leave you with a clear sense of what the ChiRunning technique feels like in your body. This is part of a two day clinic. Day 1 will focus on the basics of ChiWalking (which is the foundation to the ChiRunning form) along with heart rate training. Day 2 will focus on ChiRunning including the basics of the ChiRunning technique plus advanced techniques for breathing, running uphill, and running downhill. You will also receive a personalized video analysis or your running form! We will not be doing lots of running, so no matter what condition you're in, have no fear. We will spend time alternating between demonstrations, fun exercises, and technique drills - the nature of the series will be relaxed, fun, and inspiring. Beneficial for walkers to beginner runners all the way to ultra marathoners. Venue: Ultimate Obstacles

node.title: 03/26/2022 | Form Focus Walk / Run | Shannon Smith
node._chi_workshop_additional_date_details: Rain Date - March 27th
node._chi_workshop_description:
Join your local ChiRunning instructors for a fun run along the beautiful West Boylston Rail Trail that follows the Quinapoxet River. This is the perfect time to visit with like minded ChiWalkers and ChiRunners while revisiting the basic components of the Chi Running technique.
We will start with body looseners before beginning our easy walk/run. The run is designed for technique and open to runners of all abilities and speed. This is a "no drop" activity, meaning that it is designed to have an instructor at the front of the pack for faster runners and one at the back of the pack for walkers/slower runners, leaving no one behind.
Venue: Ultimate Obstacles

100% of all money raised will go to The CASA Project to help abused and neglected children in Worcester County. https://www.thecasaproject.org/
Additional information will be shared upon registration.

node.title: 1/04/2022 | Virtual Chi Run Intro Class | Amy Peacock
node._chi_workshop_address: Zoom - Link will be emailed upon registration
node._chi_workshop_description:
This virtual class with cover an overview of the ChiRun form and philosophy. We will practice good posture and drills so you can sense what good posture, alignment and moving from your center means, and immediately apply these skills on your next run and walk.
All workshop participants get FREE access to The Run Show USA in Boston using the code: CHIRUNNING at checkout

node.title: 1/13/2022 | Virtual ChiRun Intro Class | Amy Peacock
node._chi_workshop_address: Zoom -Link will be emailed upon registration.
node._chi_workshop_description:
In this virtual class, you will learn the ChiRun form and philosophy. We will also practice good posture, alignment, and relaxation drills. In this intro, you will gain immediately applicable tips on enhancing your running skills and avoiding common injuries.
All workshop participants get FREE access to The Run Show USA in Boston using the code: CHIRUNNING at checkout

node.title: 01/08/22 | ChiRunning Half Day | Lisa Pozzoni & Henry Walker
node._chi_workshop_purchase_url: If you are a referral from Lisa pay here: https://therunninguniversity.as.me/chirunningwithLisa If you are a referral from Henry pay here: https://chirunninginstructorhenrywalker.as.me/ChiRunningWithHenry
node._chi_workshop_description:
We will guide you through many exercises and drills designed to leave you with a clear sense of what the Chi Running technique feels like in your body. You will learn: Posture, Foot Placement, Lean, Arm Swing, Knee Bending, Stride Length, Cadence and more. We will not be doing lots of running (contrary to what you might imagine), so no matter what condition you are in, have no fear. We will spend time alternating between demonstrations, fun exercises and technique drills … the nature of the day will be relaxed, full and inspiring. This workshop is appropriate for everyone, from the beginner to the elite!
  • The Keys to Effortless, Injury-free Running
  • The Physics of Running: Run without Using Your Legs
  • Chi Running versus Power Running
  • Introduction to the Chi Running Form
  • Injury prevention techniques
  • Personal Check-in Tricks and Tools
  • Technique Drills and Exercises
  • How to conserve energy at any speed
  • Video Analysis of your form at the beginning of class
  • This investment will out weigh the hassle/money/time off that you would deal with a running injury! Prevention vs. Treatment!
All workshop participants get FREE access to The Run Show USA in Boston using the code: CHIRUNNING at checkout

node._chi_workshop_description:
Whether an advanced runner or a beginner, you will learn how to run with energy efficiency and eliminate injuries. I will be guiding you through many exercises and drills designed to leave you with a clear sense of what the ChiRunning technique feels like in your body. We will not be doing lots of running (contrary to what you might imagine), so no matter what condition you are in, have no fear. We will spend time alternating between demonstrations, fun exercises, and technique drills. The nature of the day will be relaxed, fun, and inspiring.
All workshop participants get FREE access to The Run Show USA in Boston using the code: CHIRUNNING at checkout

node.title: 2/22/2022-3/30/2022 | Mindfulness + ChiRunning | Marc Waxman
node._chi_workshop_additional_date_details: This course is virtual and runs 1x/week for six weeks for 1.5 hours.
node._chi_workshop_description: This unique course explores the intersection of running, flow, mindfulness, meditation, and performance. Please email Coach Marc at coachmarc113@gmail.com for more information.

node.title: 03/05/2022 | Advanced ChiRunning | Marc Waxman
node._chi_workshop_description: Led by the 2020 ChiRunning Instructor of the Year, this workshop is only for experienced ChiRunners. The 3-hour workshops delves into the nuance of technique in order to enhance performance. Topics include running for speed, advanced hill running, incorporating mindfulness into running, etc.

node.title: 03/14/2022-4/4/2022 | Introduction to ChiRunning – Virtual Course | Marc Waxman
node._chi_workshop_additional_date_details: This workshop runs 1x/week for 1.25 hours for 4 weeks.
node._chi_workshop_description: The perfect solution for those who can’t make it to an in-person workshop! This workshop covers the same material as a typical Introduction to ChiRunning Workshop.
